36K.F.summary: Klaveness Combination Carriers ASA owns and operates combination carriers in Norway, the Far East, the Middle East, Australia, Brazil, and North America. The company operates in two segments, CABU and CLEANBU. Its vessels transport caustic coda solution, floating fertilizer, molasses, and various types of dry cargo, as well as petroleum products, heavy liquid cargoes, and various types of dry bulk products, such as alumina, bauxite. Iron ore, salt, and coal. Its fleet consists of 17 vessels. The company was founded in 1952 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway. Klaveness Combination Carriers ASA is a subsidiary of Klaveness Ship Holding AS.

AMSC.OL.summary: American Shipping Company ASA, through its subsidiaries, operates as a ship owning and lease finance company in the United States. The company is involved in the purchase and bareboat chartering of product tankers, shuttle tankers, and other vessels to operators and end users in the Jones Act market. It operates a fleet of nine product tankers and one shuttle tanker. The company was formerly known as Aker American Shipping ASA and changed its name to American Shipping Company ASA in June 2008. American Shipping Company ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

ASCJF.summary: American Shipping Company ASA, through its subsidiaries, operates as a ship owning and lease finance company in the United States. The company is involved in the purchase and bareboat chartering of product tankers, shuttle tankers, and other vessels to operators and end users in the Jones Act market. It operates a fleet of nine product tankers and one shuttle tanker. The company was formerly known as Aker American Shipping ASA and changed its name to American Shipping Company ASA in June 2008. American Shipping Company ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

AXXIS.OL.summary: Axxis Geo Solutions ASA operates as an ocean bottom node seismic company. The company delivers tailored seismic solutions; and provides flexible project management and execution services to oil and gas companies worldwide. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Lysaker, Norway.

BELCO.OL.summary: Belships ASA owns and operates dry bulk ships worldwide. It operates through Dry Bulk and Technical Management segments. The company operates a fleet of 23 ships. It also provides commercial management and ship management services. The company was founded in 1918 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway.

F1K.F.summary: Fjord1 ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates passenger ferries and other passenger boats in Norway. The company operates through four segments: Ferry, Passenger Boat, Catering, and Tourism. The company's ferries and passenger boats transport vehicles and passengers. It also offers catering and tourism, shipyard, and travel agency services; and owns properties. The company was founded in 1958 and is headquartered in FlorÃ¸, Norway. Fjord1 ASA is a subsidiary of Havilafjord AS.

FJORD.OL.summary: Fjord1 ASA, together with its subsidiaries, operates passenger ferries and other passenger boats in Norway. The company operates through four segments: Ferry, Passenger Boat, Catering, and Tourism. The company's ferries and passenger boats transport vehicles and passengers. It also offers catering and tourism, shipyard, and travel agency services; and owns properties. The company was founded in 1958 and is headquartered in FlorÃ¸, Norway. Fjord1 ASA is a subsidiary of Havilafjord AS.

GEOS.OL.summary: Golden Energy Offshore Services AS, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the shipping business in Europe and Africa. The company owns 4 platform supply vessels. Golden Energy Offshore Services AS was incorporated in 2013 and is headquartered in Aalesund, Norway.

H2J.SG.summary: Oceanteam ASA operates as an offshore shipping company in Mexico, Latin America, West Africa, and the Asia-Pacific. It operates through Oceanteam Shipping and Oceanteam Solutions segments. The company owns, charters, and manages two deep water offshore construction support vessels, and two fast support vessels (FSVs). It also provides equipment for offshore cable laying, umbilical installations, on and offshore cable storage, and cable transportation; and designs and engineers platforms and infrastructures for the oil and gas and renewables industry. In addition, the company rents tensioners, turntables, and reels. It serves oil and gas, offshore renewables, and civil engineering sectors. The company was formerly known as Oceanteam Shipping ASA and changed its name to Oceanteam ASA in December 2015. Oceanteam ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Bergen, Norway.

H4S.F.summary: Havila Shipping ASA, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the shipping business. It manages and operates offshore service vessels primarily in the Norwegian, British, and Danish sectors of the North Sea; and Belgium, the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, and the Mediterranean Sea. The company operates a fleet of 23 vessels, including 5 anchor handling vessels, 14 platform supply vessels, 1 rescue recovery vessel, and 3 subsea vessels. Its anchor handling tug and supply vessels are used for moving rigs and putting out anchors, as well as for supply services; platform supply vessels are used to carry goods, water, drilling mud, chemicals, etc. to and from the offshore installations; subsea vessels are used for under water construction work, as well as for support for under water operations; and rescue recovery vessels are used to offer security services, such as oil spill preparedness, fire protection, and rescue operation. The company was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in FosnavÃ¥g, Norway. Havila Shipping ASA is a subsidiary of Havila Holding AS.

HAV.OL.summary: HAV Group ASA, through its subsidiaries, provides technology and services for maritime and marine industries worldwide. The company designs and system packages for vessel construction, including SOVs for the offshore wind industry, live fish carriers for the aquaculture industry, and ferries for the transport industry. It also provides hydrogen energy systems for maritime vessels; energy design and smart control systems for a range of vessels for the marine market; and ballast water treatment systems and various other water treatment systems for the aquaculture and maritime industry. The company was incorporated in 2021 and is based in FosnavÃ¥g, Norway HAV Group ASA operates as a subsidiary of Havyard Group ASA .

HAVI.OL.summary: Havila Shipping ASA, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the shipping business. It manages and operates offshore service vessels primarily in the Norwegian, British, and Danish sectors of the North Sea; and Belgium, the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, and the Mediterranean Sea. The company operates a fleet of 23 vessels, including 5 anchor handling vessels, 14 platform supply vessels, 1 rescue recovery vessel, and 3 subsea vessels. Its anchor handling tug and supply vessels are used for moving rigs and putting out anchors, as well as for supply services; platform supply vessels are used to carry goods, water, drilling mud, chemicals, etc. to and from the offshore installations; subsea vessels are used for under water construction work, as well as for support for under water operations; and rescue recovery vessels are used to offer security services, such as oil spill preparedness, fire protection, and rescue operation. The company was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in FosnavÃ¥g, Norway. Havila Shipping ASA is a subsidiary of Havila Holding AS.

KCC.OL.summary: Klaveness Combination Carriers ASA owns and operates combination carriers in Norway, the Far East, the Middle East, Australia, Brazil, and North America. The company operates in two segments, CABU and CLEANBU. Iron ore, salt, and coal. Its fleet consists of 17 vessels. The company was founded in 1952 and is headquartered in Oslo, Norway. Klaveness Combination Carriers ASA is a subsidiary of Klaveness Ship Holding AS.

MP2.F.summary: MPC Container Ships ASA owns and operates a portfolio of container ships. It focuses on the feeder vessels between 1,000 and 3,000 TEU. The company charters out its vessels to liner shipping companies and regional carriers. MPC Container Ships ASA was incorporated in 2017 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

MPCC.OL.summary: MPC Container Ships ASA owns and operates a portfolio of container ships. It focuses on the feeder vessels between 1,000 and 3,000 TEU. The company charters out its vessels to liner shipping companies and regional carriers. MPC Container Ships ASA was incorporated in 2017 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

MPZZF.summary: MPC Container Ships ASA owns and operates a portfolio of container ships. It focuses on the feeder vessels between 1,000 and 3,000 TEU. The company charters out its vessels to liner shipping companies and regional carriers. MPC Container Ships ASA was incorporated in 2017 and is based in Oslo, Norway.

O7F.F.summary: Odfjell SE engages in the transportation and storage of bulk liquid chemicals, acids, edible oils, and other special products. The company operates through three segments: Chemical Tankers, Tank Terminals, and Gas Carriers. It owns and operates chemical tankers that offers global and regional transportation; tank terminals, which provides storage of various chemical and petroleum products; and LPG/ethylene carriers. As of December 31, 2020, it operated a chemical tanker fleet of 89 vessels, including 36 owned, 7 bareboat chartered, 15 time chartered vessels, 13 leased, and 18 pool vessels, as well as 2 LPG/ethylene carriers. The company's terminal network comprises of 470 tanks with 1.3 million cubic meters of storage capacity. It operates in Norway, the Netherlands, rest of Europe, North America, South America, the Middle East, Asia, Australasia, and Africa. Odfjell SE was founded in 1914 and is headquartered in Bergen, Norway.

Odfjell SE was founded in 1914 and is headquartered in Bergen, Norway.

OCY.OL.summary: Ocean Yield ASA, a vessel owning company, invests in vessels on long-term charters in Norway. It operates through Tankers, Container Vessels, Car Carriers, Other Shipping, Other Oil Service, FPSO, and Other segments. The company has a fleet consisting of 68 vessels, including tankers, container vessels, dry-bulk, car carriers, gas carriers, and oil service vessels. Ocean Yield ASA was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

The company was formerly known as Oceanteam Shipping ASA and changed its name to Oceanteam ASA in December 2015. Oceanteam ASA was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Bergen, Norway.

It operates through Tankers, Container Vessels, Car Carriers, Other Shipping, Other Oil Service, FPSO, and Other segments. The company has a fleet consisting of 68 vessels, including tankers, container vessels, dry-bulk, car carriers, gas carriers, and oil service vessels. Ocean Yield ASA was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

OYIEF.summary: Ocean Yield ASA, a vessel owning company, invests in vessels on long-term charters in Norway. Ocean Yield ASA was founded in 2012 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway.

RISH.OL.summary: GC Rieber Shipping ASA engages in the design, development, and maritime operation of offshore vessels within the offshore/shipping business in Norway, Great Britain, Germany, Africa, and rest of Europe. It operates through Subsea & Renewables and Ice/Support segments. The company owns and operates subsea and renewable vessels that are primarily used for construction, inspection, maintenance, and repair of subsea installations and cables, as well as offers marine ship management and project development services. It operates 13 vessels and has direct and indirect ownership of 29 advanced special purpose vessels. The company was founded in 1879 and is headquartered in Bergen, Norway. GC Rieber Shipping ASA is a subsidiary of GC Rieber AS.

S5B.F.summary: Axxis Geo Solutions ASA operates as an ocean bottom node seismic company. The company delivers tailored seismic solutions; and provides flexible project management and execution services to oil and gas companies worldwide. The company was founded in 2006 and is based in Lysaker, Norway.

WILS.OL.summary: Wilson ASA, a short sea company, engages in the chartering and operation of vessels in the short sea bulk sector in Europe. It operates through a fleet of 122 vessels in the range of 1500-8500 dwt. The company was founded in 1923 and is based in Bergen, Norway. Wilson ASA is a subsidiary of Caiano AS.

WML1.F.summary: Wilh. Wilhelmsen Holding ASA provides maritime products and services in Europe, the Americas, Asia, Africa, and Oceania. It operates in Maritime Services and Supply Services segments. The Maritime Services segment offers marine products, ship agency services, and logistics to the merchant fleet, as well as ship management services, including manning for various vessel types. The Supply Services segment engages in the operation of supply bases for the offshore industry; development and operation of real estate properties on and off the supply bases; and maintenance of rigs and handling of logistics related to international pipeline projects and windmill parks. The company's marine products include Unitor chemicals and equipment to clean vessels; Unitor fuel treatment chemicals; Unitor oil spill kits and other damage control solutions; Unitor cylinders; Timm ropes; Unitor equipment for the maintenance and performance vessels; and Nalfleet water treatment products to treat and protect on board systems, as well as Unicool refrigerants. It also provides marine and non-marine insurance services; and maritime training solutions. The company was founded in 1861 and is headquartered in Lysaker, Norway. Wilh. Wilhelmsen Holding ASA is a subsidiary of Tallyman AS.
